titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Gary Rosenberg is Pilsbry Chair of Malacology and Vice-President for Systematic Biology and Library at the Academy of Natural Sciences of Philadelphia. He received his Ph.D. in organismic and evolutionary biology from Harvard University in 1989. He had worked as a volunteer in the Malacology Department while he was in high school, and after earning his doctorate, he returned to the Academy as Assistant Curator of Malacology. He is the author of The Encyclopedia of Sea Shells, published in 1992.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of three galley proofs of Rosenberg's Encyclopedia of Sea Shells, one with color illustrations.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
